vlibtour.vlibtour_client_scenario

Class VLibTourVisitTouristApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • vlibtour.vlibtour_client_scenario.VLibTourVisitTouristApplication

  • public class VLibTourVisitTouristApplication
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the client application of the tourists. The access to the lobby room server, to the group communication system, and to the visit emulation server visit should be implemented using the design pattern Delegation (see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Delegation_pattern). A client creates two queues to receive messages from the broker; the binding keys are of the form "*.*.identity" and "*.*.location" while the routing keys are of the form "sender.receiver.identity|location". This class uses the classes MapHelper and BasicMap for displaying the tourists on the map of Paris. Use the attributes for the color, the map, the map marker dot, etc.
    Author:
    Denis Conan

    • Constructor Detail

      • VLibTourVisitTouristApplication

        public VLibTourVisitTouristApplication(java.lang.String tourId,
                                       java.lang.String groupId,
                                       java.lang.String userId,
                                       java.lang.Boolean group_creator)
                                throws vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_api.InAMQPPartException,
                                       vlibtour.vlibtour_tour_management.entity.VlibTourTourManagementException,
                                       java.io.IOException,
                                       com.rabbitmq.tools.jsonrpc.JsonRpcException,
                                       java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                       java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                       javax.naming.NamingException,
                                       java.lang.Exception
        creates a client application, which will join a group that must already exist. The group identifier is optional whether this is the first user of the group ---i.e. the group identifier is built upon the user identifier. Concerning the tour identifier, it must be provided by the calling method.
        Parameters:
        tourId - the tour identifier of this application.
        groupId - the group identifier of this client application.
        userId - the user identifier of this client application.
        Throws:
        vlibtour.vlibtour_lobby_room_api.InAMQPPartException - the exception thrown in case of a problem in the AMQP part.
        vlibtour.vlibtour_tour_management.entity.VlibTourTourManagementException - problem in the name or description of POIs.
        java.io.IOException - problem when setting the communication configuration with the broker.
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - problem in creation of connection, channel, client before the RPC to the lobby room.
        com.rabbitmq.tools.jsonrpc.JsonRpcException - problem in creation of connection, channel, client before the RPC to the lobby room.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - thread interrupted in call sleep.
        javax.naming.NamingException - the EJB server has not been found when getting the tour identifier.
        java.lang.Exception

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        executes the tourist application.
        We prefer insert comments in the method instead of detailing the method here.
        Parameters:
        args - the command line arguments.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - all the potential problems (since this is a demonstrator, apply the strategy "fail fast").
